ygData.subject: Re: Question about lvl 20 and lvl 21 song
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I ve been meaning to time this, but haven t gotten around to it.  Visually, I seem to notice them hitting slower. ... L21 is Mellifluous Motion - a random
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 29 Jun 1999, CMai wrote:
>
> I am currently at lvl 20. I do not see the used of lvl 20
> song at all and I was hoping that it does what the song
> list say it does which is -AC and slow down the attack
> rate. I do not see that when I used it against a blue.
> It said that it is binding and all. could anyone tell me
> if they have ever had any success with this song? Also I

I've been meaning to time this, but haven't gotten around to
it. Visually, I seem to notice them hitting slower.

> am very close to lvl 21 and I was wondering if I should
> buy it since I am very short on PP. The lvl 21 song is
> supposed to be very similar to lvl 20 right?

L21 is Mellifluous Motion - a random teleport within the zone.
I think you are talking about the L23 song, the Constant
Chain. This is basically a short-term snare (never seen it
last more than the standard 3 ticks). It is VERY useful for
snagging those monsters that like to run and bring back
friends, especially since the bard can "cast" it while chasing
(spellcasters can't do that). I think it was weakened
recently, as last night I had mobs I'd chained breaking out of
it frequently before the 3 ticks were up, and a couple times
almost immediately. I'd rarely seen that before.

The L21 song is fun to play with, but it's not necessary.
Save your platinum if you like.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
